Having the same problem as btford, attaching fairings dont actually connect. And sometimes I cant get them to connect to the base properly. I feel like I'm just missing something.
I downloaded vanilla, unmodded 20.2 and the fairings work fine. Hrm.

I just got done updating everything to the new filing system, now working on a few bugs including the fairing jettison sounds being broken.

Should have it uploaded in a bit.

edit:

It would seem that it's impossible to make custom sounds work any more even using the same system the stock parts appear to use, so those will have to wait.

Awesome, can't wait!

It would seem that it's impossible to make custom sounds work any more even using the same system the stock parts appear to use, so those will have to wait.

It is, but you'll have to ask Snjo about it - he does it for firespitter, and might be able to tell you how to do it without plugin code

I just got done updating everything to the new filing system, now working on a few bugs including the fairing jettison sounds being broken.

Should have it uploaded in a bit.

edit:

It would seem that it's impossible to make custom sounds work any more even using the same system the stock parts appear to use, so those will have to wait.

Squad's custom parts are in the KSP_Root/GameData/Squad/Parts folder. The custom sounds are located in the KSP_Root/GameData/Squad/Sounds folder with the sound activation line "custom_sound = action_name" added in a custom part's part.cfg file. In the case of KW Rocketry... the sound activation line should be "sound_kwfairing_jettison = activate" I believe. Note the lack of ".wav" in this line. Your previous KW Rocketry for 0.19.1 had "sound_kwfairing_jettison.wav = activate" and may not work with KSP 0.20.2 anymore. Here is an example of the sound activation line from Squad's decoupler1-2 part.cfg file...

sound_decoupler_fire = decouple

So KW Rocketry should be something like this...

KSP_Root/GameData/KW Rocketry/Parts <------ KW Rocketry parts go here

KSP_Root/GameData/KW Rocketry/Sounds <---- KW Rocketry custom sounds go here

... and any custom sound's activation line would like something like this...

sound_kwfairing_jettison = activate

This won't work for KW Rocketry with KSP 0.20.2? Hope this helps and is correct.

Alright, it's up.

Please let me know if I missed anything.

OK... I'm stumped on this...

I can't get your addon to load up...

I'm running .20.2, I've downloaded and installed it, I watch the loading screen and I see the package loading up along with all of my other mods. but when I start up the game... KW parts are all missing. I mean not a single one.

I've now deleted, redownloaded and reinstalled the pack 4 times. Same thing every time... I see the game load the files, they just don't show up in the VAB.

I even tried to install them the old way and no go... I didn't think that would work but, had to give everything a try before I posted here.

Anyone else have this happening? And any help is always appreciated... Thanks

Working for me... and either I'm misremembering or the parts are actually showing up better organized now. (This does mean they might not be in the same places they were before you updated, make sure you look carefully...)

Edited June 2, 2013 by Gaius
Oh I have M8... Thats why I said I was stumped... I'm going to try a fresh install of KSP .20.2 now to see if that fixes it... It has to be another mod not playing nice or something.

Here is an example of the sound activation line from Squad's decoupler1-2 part.cfg file...

So KW Rocketry should be something like this...

... and any custom sound's activation line would like something like this...

This won't work for KW Rocketry with KSP 0.20.2? Hope this helps and is correct.

Going to try Fairings on 20.2 fresh install. Will report back.

Ok here is what I found.

KW 0.2.33 on a fresh install of 20.2.186 (in LEGACY mod folders, parts and such in the base folder and NOT the gamedata folder) I did not have any issues with fairings.

If you have the mod in the gamedata folder you will only see about 1/2 of the parts.
